author: Joe Leasure

comment:
Seriously Andy you need to actually take a step back. You are letting the fact that you decided he was innocent from day 1 cloud your judgement.  For example, let's look at Incident 14  specifically part iv) of the ruling relating to the police officers. The reason doubt was put on their testimony was as follows

1) They didn't take contemporaneous notes. The first notes on the incident come from when they were deposed months later 
2) These notes produced months later contain discrepancies, for example claiming they were there for between 30 and 60mins when CCTV shows its 15mins
3) Only 1 of the officers gave oral testimony, the other written
4) Neither were available to have their testimony cross-examined.

Ultimately it's the last one that's most important and it's what makes their testimonies hearsay.  So their evidence being deemed to hold less weight is perfectly legit. It would be exactly the same in most countries criminal systems as its important that testimonies are able to be crossed. If they had both been available to be crossed and also if they had taken notes at the time rather than having to do the notes from memory months later then this evidence would have held way more weight as law enforcement testimony is generally held in high regard.  That was another consistent mistake of his team, they got witness statements off people and character references but for many they never had these taken under oath and those what were they didn't make available for cross. And then people like you wonder why his witness were held in less regard


And Depps witness and evidence in most cases have way more issues than The Suns and it's not helped by Depp destroying his credibility with the lies he told in his statement to the court that he then got caught in, often by his own evidence in the form of messages and recordings. And in civil cases it can often come down to whose evidence has less issues. 

Mind you the simple fact is that even if they could destroy every piece of testimony from her and her witnesses and they could show she also abused him, Depp would still lose BECAUSE his own discovery shows he is guilty. That's what people aren't realising, recordings and messages he disclosed have both him and his witness who later back him admitting to the assaults. Being abused on other occasions does not absolve you of fault.  People who are dying on this hill to defend him have chosen the wrong one to die on. If you think she is also guilty that's fine (The evidence seems to suggest she did also abuse him) but to keep trying to excuse an abuser, especially one who can change if he accepted the illness he has and made a real effort to kick it rather than the half hearted attempt at rehab. It just gives anyone being abused the wrong message

comment: Good video.  You make interest points... still I said it previously and sadly predicted this outcome.... The dice were loaded from the start.  We are asking the wrong questions... Think about it just one second.  Johnny Depp is confronting the Sun Newspaper owned by Rupert Murdoch, who also owns so many media, one in particular FoxNews... that in fact was the primary tool used to elect Donal Trump... So, Rupert Murdoch owns large numbers of shares in the movie media... on the board of Disney and/or Warner... now the real question... what is his real objective in taking down Johnny Depp... The following question... JD has in fact an incredible power to negotiate... with a big fan base... He can in fact negotiate his salary at the end of the scale... Is there some advantage for Rupert Murdoch to either reduce JD bargaining power or simply attach a rival movie media and so increase his share and power... Is it possible in a previous buyout where JD was linked and refused to participate...  this is the only avenue to follow at this point... We should stop talking about the facts... they don‚Äôt matter any more with a judge that been bought... questioning the facts, the validity of the ruling seems secondary... we must go to the puppet master, the Voldemort, the one no one accepts to prononce his name... Rupert Murdoch...

author: mike pilkington

comment:
I've said before, being British, our justice system is something I loathe. In cases like this, the British media have the freedom to say anything they want. The victim of that slander has to be the one to take them to court to prove their not what is being portrayed! I've previously referenced the Meghan Markle letters to her dad. Written and addressed to him and yet she had to take the papers to court for invasion of privacy. The British Media can't be held accountable until taken to court and yet even when outcomes are won, say if Johnny had won his case, they'd still go ahead and print the same headlines but put alleged in front....Its very dangerous, damaging and it undermines real Journalism. 
The main argument here, is that they have judged this as a criminal trial and as though a criminal trial has already proceeded. The judgement should have been on the slander by NGN towards Johnny Depp. Unfortunately and horrifically the backwards British system means that everyone and their aunt can have input. In my opinion, NGN should never of legally been allowed to a) print a comment like they did with no evidence / conviction and b) be allowed to call Amber to the stand to ‚Äúprove their case‚Äù after Johnny filed the lawsuit against Amber as it is 100% a conflict of interest when she has something to gain from that outcome in her own criminal trial. 
Yet here we are and in other more recent cases we continue to see it. A West Midlands Police officer physically and verbally assaulted a woman by grabbing her by the back of the neck, calling her names and trying to pull her to the ground. He admitted in court that he assaulted her. The courts decided that he would receive a 14-week overnight curfew, wear a tag and pay compensations and court costs. So for the grand total of ¬£680 (¬£500 to victim, ¬£180 to courts) you can assault a woman... It's a screwed up legal world here in the UK!

Edit: Sorry for waffling!

comment:
This hearing had nothing to do with justice. They literally discarded everything that did not adhere to AH narrative. Because reasons.
Under normal conditions discrepancies in testimonies are being considered a fail. But as it is often with women with gynocentric justice system, up is down. When a guy commits a crime, while intoxicated, its an aggravating circumstance, he was irresponsible and punishment should be increased. When a woman commits a crime, while intoxicated, it is often a mitigating circumstance, she was not in full control of her mental faculties and therefore should receive lesser sentence. There is a reason why for women "mental problems" are a goto excuse in court.
As far as "errors of this kind are very common" - bullshit, complete and absolute bullshit. Lawyers work with their clients extremely thoroughly to avoid exactly those mistakes. To dot all "i's" and cross all "t's", as their opposition can completely destroy, in an unbiased legal system. any credibility that person has. Only reason not to properly "train" a client is if outcome is predetermined.

author: ImperialJess

comment:
The UK courts a joke. We used to have ‚Äúsuper injunctions‚Äù. An injunction is when you get wind of a story about to be published and so you get your lawyers to get them to redact as much personal info as possible but run the story still. So we would get articles like ‚Äúsports star for Manchester United has had an affair‚Äù

Then they allowed for a while ‚Äúsuper‚Äù injunctions which were the courts forcing the press not to air the story at all. Not any details, nothing.
 

There is also a man called  TOMATO ROBIN SON.   You will need to remove the ATO and replace it with ‚Äúmy‚Äù you can‚Äôt spell his name on YouTube comments in some instances.

He was arrested, charged and sentenced in the same day. He had no time to get his lawyer. The media hate him and they said he was guilty regardless.  The man is controversial and I won‚Äôt get into whether his opinions are dangerous. But he was reporting on a court case. He was naming the accused individuals and they jailed him for ‚Äúcontempt of court‚Äù.

The UK justice system is fucked. It does not exist.
